Detailed Description

This action creates particles.

The source PSA generally creates particles at a rate over time, particles per second.

The source PSA can also generate particles on demand, and if set to a particular node, can generate particles by movement. The activePeriod and sleepPeriod/sleepPeriodMax values allow periodic creation of particles over time.

All of these properties can be working simultaneously for a single source.

The grounded attribute, if set to true, will force particles to drop to the ground or scene from where they appear.

float SourcePSA::activePeriod ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the activePeriod property.

This is the length in seconds where the source will generate particles at the rate given when its timeTriggered flag is true.

Returns:
Period in seconds of activity when timeTriggered is true.

void SourcePSA::allowedTime ( float  timeInSeconds  ) 

This is the Set-Accessor for the allowedTime property.

Parameters:
timeInSeconds This is the new allowedTime value.

float SourcePSA::allowedTime ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the allowedTime property.

For grounded sources, the collision detection can take a long time. The allowedTime sets a maximum allowed time in seconds for the source to create its particles. The values supplied through the interface are in seconds, although the actual allowedTime is stored as CPU clock cycles (or timestamps.)

Returns:
The maximum time allowed in a frame for the SourcePSA to create particles. Units in seconds.

void SourcePSA::create ( int  number  ) 

This method will create a number of particles over time according to the rate, sleepPeriod and activePeriod properties.

No more than the required number will be created.

Parameters:
number The number of particles to be created on demand over time.

void SourcePSA::force ( int  number  ) 

This method will force the creation of a number of particles or particle chains on the next execute() invocation.

No more than the required number will be created. The forcedUnitSize times this number is the number of particles in total. The forcedUnitSize is the length of separate chains that will be created, while the forced number stands for the number of actual chains.

Parameters:
number The number of particles/chains to be forced.

void SourcePSA::forcedUnitSize ( int  newUnitSize  ) 

This is the Set-Accessor for the forcedUnitSize property.

Parameters:
newUnitSize How many particles force(1) will create.

int SourcePSA::forcedUnitSize ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the forcedUnitSize property.

This number is the number of particles created for each unit of the forced total. The default value is set to 1.

Returns:
The number of particles created per forceTotal unit.

bool SourcePSA::grounded ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor to the grounded flag.

If set to true, each particle generated will be dropped to the terrain or scene below it. If there is no terrain or scene, nothing will be done.

Returns:
The grounded flag value.

Parameters:
flag The new value for the motionTrigger flag.

bool SourcePSA::motionTriggered ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor to the motionTrigger flag.

If set to true, the source will generate particles when the model to which it is attached moves. The amount of particles generated is dependent on the sensitivity of the source.

Returns:
The motionTrigger flag value.

void SourcePSA::sensitivity ( float  value  ) 

This is the Set-Accessor for the sensitivity property.

Note: Sensitivity cannot be set to zero - it means infinite particles would be generated on any finite displacement. If sensitivity is set below a threshold of 0.0001, it will be forced to that minimum threshold.

Parameters:
value The number of metres moved before a particle is generated.

float SourcePSA::sensitivity ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the sensitivity property.

This is how sensitive the source is to movement on its model. The value is speed in metres per second.

No particles are generated if the particle system moved at less than the sensitivity. If the particle system moved at N times sensitivity, then (N-1)*2 particles would be generated.

Returns:
The number of metres moved before a particle is generated.

bool SourcePSA::timeTriggered ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor to the timeTriggered flag.

If set to true, the source will generate particles over time according to the rate set. No particles will be generated when the particle is in its sleep period.

Returns:
The timeTriggered flag value.
